ThingDef.label: anchovy
ThingDef.description: Raw anchovy. A small, common forage fish of the family Engraulidae. Most species are found in marine waters, but several will enter brackish water and some are restricted to fresh water.

ThingDef.label: angelfish
ThingDef.description: Raw angelfish. Angelfish refers to several species of fish, both marine and freshwater, usually sporting bright colours and deep, laterally compressed bodies.

ThingDef.label: anglerfish
ThingDef.description: Raw anglerfish. Anglerfish are bony fish named for their characteristic mode of predation, in which, a fleshy growth from the fish's head (the esca or illicium) acts as a lure towards other fish.

ThingDef.label: clownfish
ThingDef.description: Raw clownfish. In the wild, clownfish form symbiotic mutualisms with sea anemones. Depending on species, clownfish are overall yellow, orange, or a reddish or blackish color, and many show white bars or patches.

ThingDef.label: eel
ThingDef.description: Raw eel. An eel is any ray-finned fish belonging to the order Anguilliformes. Eels are elongated fish, possessing no pelvic fins, and many species also lacking pectoral fins. Eels swim by generating body waves which travel the length of their bodies.

ThingDef.label: goldfish
ThingDef.description: Raw goldfish. The goldfish (Carassius auratus) is a freshwater fish in the family Cyprinidae of order Cypriniformes. It is one of the most commonly kept aquarium fish.

ThingDef.label: haddock
ThingDef.description: Raw haddock. The haddock (Melanogrammus aeglefinus) is a saltwater fish from the family Gadidae, the true cods. It is an important food fish and has traditionaly been consumed either fresh or smoked.

ThingDef.label: halibut
ThingDef.description: Raw halibut. Halibut is a common name principally applied to the two flatfish from the family of right-eye flounders. Less commonly, and in some regions only, other species of flatfish are also referred to as being halibuts.

ThingDef.label: herring
ThingDef.description: Raw herring. Herring are forage fish, mostly belonging to the family Clupeidae. Herring often move in large schools around fishing banks and near the coast.

ThingDef.label: koi
ThingDef.description: Raw koi. Koi are colored varieties of the Amur carp (Cyprinus rubrofuscus) that are kept for decorative purposes in outdoor koi ponds or water gardens.

ThingDef.label: lobster
ThingDef.description: Raw lobster. Lobsters are large marine crustaceans. Lobsters have long bodies with muscular tails. Three of their five pairs of legs have claws, including the first pair, which are usually much larger than the others.

ThingDef.label: mackerel
ThingDef.description: Raw mackerel. Mackerel is a common name applied to a number of different species of pelagic fish, mostly from the family Scombridae. They are found in both temperate and tropical seas, mostly living along the coast or offshore in the oceanic environment.

ThingDef.label: minnow
ThingDef.description: Raw minnow. Minnow is the common name for a number of species of small freshwater fish, belonging to several genera of the family Cyprinidae.

ThingDef.label: perch
ThingDef.description: Raw perch. Perch is a common name for fish of the genus Perca, freshwater gamefish belonging to the family Percidae. The perch lend their name to a large order of vertebrates: the Perciformes. Many species of freshwater gamefish more or less resemble perch, but belong to different genera.

ThingDef.label: pufferfish
ThingDef.description: Raw pufferfish. Pufferfish are a family of primarily marine and estuarine fish. The majority of pufferfish species are toxic and some are among the most poisonous vertebrates in the world. In certain species, the internal organs, such as the liver, and sometimes their skin, contain tetrodotoxin and are highly toxic to most animals when eaten; nevertheless, the meat of some species is considered a delicacy when prepared by specially trained chefs.

ThingDef.label: sprat
ThingDef.description: Raw sprat. Sprat is the common name applied to a group of forage fish belonging to the genus Sprattus in the family Clupeidae. Like most forage fishes, sprats are highly active, small, oily fish. They travel in large schools with other fish and swim continuously throughout the day.

ThingDef.label: swordfish
ThingDef.description: Raw swordfish. Swordfish, also known as broadbills, are large, highly migratory, predatory fish characterized by a long, flat, pointed bill.

ThingDef.label: trout
ThingDef.description: Raw trout. Trout is the common name for a number of species of freshwater fish. Most species of trout live in freshwater lakes and rivers exclusively, while there are others, such as the steelhead, which can spend two or three years at sea before returning to fresh water to spawn (a habit more typical of salmon).
